author: Special Correspondent
text:
The acquittal of 288 ‘Tamils’, who were facing murder and red sanders smuggling charges, in a Tirupati court on Wednesday was “only because of the efforts” taken by Chief Minister Jayalalithaa, a State government release said.

Listing out the efforts taken by Ms. Jayalalithaa, it stated that the effective arguments of advocates who argued the case on the orders of the Chief Minister had resulted in the acquittal of the 288 Tamils.

The advocates appeared in the case during the 20 hearings.

The release also recalled the efforts of Ms. Jayalalithaa in getting bail for 172 persons from the State, who were in prisons of Andhra Pradesh on charges of felling red sander wood.

On knowing that several persons from Tamil Nadu were imprisoned in Andhra Pradesh, the Chief Minister had instructed the Director-General of Police to obtain the details of those imprisoned. Based on the inputs, Ms. Jayalalithaa wrote a letter to her Andhra Pradesh counterpart Chandrababu Naidu urging him to release the Tamils considering the fact the charge sheet was not filed within 90 days and taking into account their modest background, the release said.

A total of 312 petitions from the families of the accused persons were received seeking free legal aid, which were forwarded to the Andhra Pradesh State Legal Services Authority in October last through the Chief Secretary.

“The Chief Minister had, on November 3, issued orders sanctioning Rs. 8 lakh as advance for litigation costs in this case, following which a total of 172 persons were released on bail,” the release said.

Jayalalithaa had written to her AP counterpart urging him to release

the Tamils
title: CM played a big role in the acquittal of 288 Tamils: govt.
